meanings.definition: The act of placing one thing on top of another
meanings.sent1: The superimposition of the book on the table was neat and tidy.
meanings.sent2: The superimposition of the map on the screen helped us understand the geography better.
meanings.sent3: During the play, the actor's superimposition of a crown on his head made the audience burst into laughter.
meanings.sent4: Her superimposition of responsibilities at work and home was like juggling multiple balls in the air.
meanings.sent5: The superimposition of colors in the painting created a beautiful and harmonious blend.

meanings.definition: The process of overlaying one image or object onto another
meanings.sent1: The superimposition of the logo on the advertisement enhanced its visual appeal.
meanings.sent2: In graphic design, superimposition is often used to create interesting visual effects.
meanings.sent3: The superimposition of a mustache on the cat's face in the photo made everyone chuckle.
meanings.sent4: His words had a superimposition of sincerity and humor that captivated the audience.
meanings.sent5: The superimposition of the ghostly figure on the old photograph gave it an eerie vibe.
